channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Redistricting deadlines for the midterms loom as states wait for a Supreme Court ruling
item.description: Depending on the timing, a Supreme Court ruling that weakens Voting Rights Act protections against racial discrimination may lead to more states redra...

item.title: How NewJeans (almost) changed K-pop
item.description: The girl group had a vision for how to rewire its troubled industry. The industry had other plans.

item.title: After months of infighting, House GOP could vote today to release the Epstein files
item.description: President Trump has pushed back against releasing the files, but shifted course over the weekend after it became clear the measure was likely to pass ...

item.title: Is a 50-year mortgage really that much crazier than a 30-year one?
item.description: Last week, the internet piled on President Trump's proposal for a 50-year mortgage. But maybe it's not as crazy as it sounds.

item.title: How 'defund Planned Parenthood' came to threaten primary care in rural Maine
item.description: Abortion is supported by 3 out of 4 Mainers, but a popular network of clinics that provides it alongside primary care has been shut out of Medicaid by...

item.title: Group of South Carolina lawmakers look at the most restrictive abortion bill in the US
Roblox announces measures to strengthen protections for minors
item.description: Facing pressure from states and families, Roblox will require players to use AI-powered technology that helps verify their age.

item.title: Brazil creates new Indigenous territories during protest-hit COP30
item.description: President Lula's government recognises 10 new Indigenous lands in an effort to protect their culture and environment.

item.title: Feds expanding N.C. immigration enforcement actions to Raleigh, mayor says
item.description: Federal immigration authorities will expand their enforcement action in North Carolina to Raleigh, the mayor said, while Customs and Border Protection...

item.title: Federal immigration agents will expand enforcement action in North Carolina to Raleigh, mayor says
item.description: Federal immigration authorities will expand their enforcement action in North Carolina to Raleigh as soon as Tuesday.

item.title: Australian murderer sues for right to eat Vegemite behind bars
item.description: Andre McKechnie argues the Vegemite ban in Victoria's jails denies him the right to "enjoy his culture".

item.title: Australia detains South African seen at neo-Nazi rally
item.description: The civil engineer was seen in the front row of a protest organised by the National Socialist Network.

item.title: Woman set on fire during fight on CTA train in Chicago's Loop
item.description: An arson investigation is underway after a woman was set on fire while riding a CTA Blue Line in Chicago's Loop on Monday night.

item.title: Mystery deepens after 4 family members die at popular tourist site
item.description: Eleven people have been detained in connection with the deaths of four members of the same family in Istanbul, the state-run Anadolu news agency said.

item.title: French energy giant Total faces war crimes allegations over Mozambique massacre
item.description: TotalEnergies denies responsibility for the actions of local security forces involved in dozens of killings.

item.title: Japan says jets scrambled as China flew drone near island close to Taiwan
item.description: Tension between Japan and China has escalated over the new Japanese leader's suggestion Tokyo could intervene militarily if Beijing attacks Taiwan.

item.title: Ex-Harvard president Larry Summers steps back from public role after Epstein email release
item.description: The former US treasury secretary says he is "ashamed" of his emails to the late sex offender.

item.title: Tennessee judge blocks Trumpâ€™s use of National Guard in Memphis but gives time for government appeal
